utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Aw, man, did you see this post from Raj?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What? Is it another video of him and his dog Lady-and-the-Tramping some spaghetti?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. He can’t afford his apartment, and he’s asking if anyone knows of a cheap place to live. I want to say India, but it seems mean.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What’s so funny?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Raj is looking for a cheap place to live, and I wrote India.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Don’t post that, be supportive.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Maybe you should be supportive of my hilarious jokes. Fine, what should we do?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We’re smart. I’m sure we can think of something.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You want to let him live here?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, we’re smarter than that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know our apartment’s small, but I think we can make room.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, Sheldon. We are not getting a life-size Spider-Man statue.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We do have Sheldon’s old room. If he really needs a place to stay, I guess we should offer it to him.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re a good friend.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Am I still a good friend if I wait and hope that Howard offers him a place to live first?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re an even better husband.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I know if the roles were reversed, he would do it for me.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Where would he stay? We already have Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, we can make some space in the garage. Maybe put a cot out there, get him a space heater, maybe a hot plate.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That sounds awful.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Let’s hope he thinks so, too.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: For the last time, no Hulk, no Batman, no life-size statues.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wow. I’m starting to think you didn’t mean it when you said you wanted to spruce up the place.

utterance.speaker: Raj (answering phone)
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, uh, so we’ve been talking, and if you need a place to stay, we’d be happy to fix up the garage for you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That would be amazing. I was literally just looking at my moving boxes, trying to pick one to live in.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I know it’s not ideal, but you’d have plenty of space for your furniture, and there’s this cool button that makes an entire wall go up and down.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I cannot thank you enough.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It is our pleasure. Hey, can you hold on one sec? Hello?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, buddy, you still looking for a place to live?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. Why do you ask?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know, we have the extra bedroom, and if you need it, it’s yours.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, my God, that’s so generous.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s the least we can do.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I really appreciate it. Uh, can you hold on one second? Hey, so, Howard, what’s the bathroom situation gonna be?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, there’s a sink out there, that takes care of half your problems.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But I can use the downstairs bathroom, right?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. We barely use it, so it’ll be like it’s yours.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Cool, cool, yeah, yeah, hold on one second.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, what’s it like sharing a bathroom with Penny? Is there hair everywhere? Does she use your loofah?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t have a loofah.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, well, if I move in, you can’t use mine. Hold on a second. Hey, Howard, uh, how’s the Wi-Fi in the garage?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know. Why are you asking all these questions?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, to be honest, Leonard’s on the other line, and he offered me their spare bedroom.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Great. Go live there.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But you made the garage sound so fun.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I just didn’t want you to feel bad about it. Unless Leonard’s apartment also has a raccoon that chews its way in on cold nights, go there.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: One second. Okay, I think we’re close. How do you feel about a mini-fridge in my room?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, pal, you want to live here or not?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, uh, hi, Penny. Yes, please.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hi, uh, Penny, this circular is addressed to occupant, but with our apartment switch, it’s unclear whether it’s yours or mine.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s it for?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Roofing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s yours.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, thanks. Just throw it out. Speaking of occupants, I’m given to understand Raj will be moving into my old room.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, for a little while.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What about his dog?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: She’ll be in her crate, it’s not a big deal.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I suppose that’s acceptable.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, Sheldon’s getting a little better with dogs. He even took a picture with Pluto at Disneyland.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If real dogs gave me buttons, I’d like them, too. Well, I think it’s very nice that you’re helping out our friend.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And I think it’s nice that you’re taking whatever medication Amy’s clearly giving you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And what is that supposed to mean?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, it’s like that science thing. For every action, you have a gigantic and annoying reaction.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just when I thought you couldn’t get any hotter.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If you’re implying that I’d have some problem with him moving into my room, you’re wrong. Raj is in a difficult financial situation, and I’m glad that he’s making changes to improve it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do not adjust the dosage. You nailed it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Don’t listen to them. What’s weird is that Penny almost got a science fact right.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I mean, it’s unfair; people just assume I’m going to be upset by Raj moving into my old room.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: But you are, aren’t you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I’m outraged.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Talk to me. Tell me what’s going on.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, that’s been my room since before I met Leonard, and now someone else is going to be living in it. And that someone else is not me. And you know how I feel about people who aren’t me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: There are a lot of memories wrapped up in that room. For me, too. The first time you told me you loved me was in that room.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wrong. We were standing outside my room in the hallway.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And there is the love of which I speak.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I realize it’s irrational, but with Raj moving in there, I’m feeling a bit replaced.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, this isn’t an easy time for him. He’s losing his apartment, he’s in debt, he’s probably humiliated.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, probably. But until we know for sure, how can I feel better?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Can I get anyone anything at all?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Raj, you don’t have to serve us.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s the least I can do for helping me carry my stuff up.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It was really no problem.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Not for you, box of towels.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Anyway, thanks again.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, look at that. You’ve got a Raj, we’ve got a Stuart. Maybe we should take them both to the park and let them run around together.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know. Yours looks like he has worms.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You ready to go?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All set.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A housewarming gift for Raj.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, a bunch of fake snakes better not spring out of it, ’cause that was a lousy anniversary present.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s nothing like that. I just, I thought about Raj’s situation, and I had a change of heart. You know, and regarding your gift, you said surprise me, and, boy, did I. Hello.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Perfect timing. Food’s ready.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, wait, before we eat, I have a little welcome to the building gift for Raj.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wait, is anything gonna jump out of that.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No. I already asked.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thank you, Sheldon. It’s a blank notebook.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I had some of my best ideas in that room, and I’m sure you will, too.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He also never had sex in that room. That’s something else to look forward to.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: This means a lot.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I know this is a difficult time for you. You’re losing your apartment, you’re in debt, and you just, you must be humiliated.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, good grief. She is such a stickler for citing sources. Those were Amy’s words.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know, I know, good grief was originally said by Charlie Brown, geez.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re right, I am humiliated. Thanks for pointing it out. You’re such a jerk.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Can you believe this guy?

utterance.speaker: Everyone
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I thought that was gonna break the other way.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Come on, Sheldon. Maybe we should just eat at our place.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. You took my room. You turned my friends against me. I hope you’re happy.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What do I have to be happy about? My life’s a wreck.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How come he can say it and I can’t?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Just keep walking.

utterance.speaker: Beverley (on skype)
utterance.content: Hello, Sheldon. What a pleasant surprise. How are you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Honestly, I’ve been better. Do you have time? Leonard says you’re very busy these days.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Oh, I just say that because he prattles. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, our friend Raj moved into my old room, and it’s brought up a lot of negative feelings for me.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Mm. Well, what do you think the loss of your room represents?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Beverley, you know I hold you in high esteem. Can we skip the part where you pretend not to know the answer, and get to the part where you tell me the answer?

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Very well, but, uh, if you don’t mind, I’d still like to pause for effect. Now, you’ve recently moved in with Dr. Fowler, yes?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I have.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Clearly, your old room represents an escape hatch, and without it, you’re forced to confront the terrifying reality of being trapped in a relationship with Amy forever.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I hadn’t thought about that.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And don’t start thinking about it now.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Hello, Amy. Your defensiveness may indicate similar insecurities about your relationship with Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s not true.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: She said defensively.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: This isn’t about me and Sheldon. This is about Rajesh moving in with Leonard and Penny.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Interesting. They’ve found a need to take yet another room mate. Seems they’re avoiding some harsh realities themselves.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I had no idea all our relationships were such a disaster. Boy, you’re good.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: That is the word on the street, dear.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Maybe moving in was a bad idea. I haven’t been here one day, I’m already causing problems.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You didn’t do anything. It’s Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You didn’t do anything, it’s Sheldon. That’d make a nice needlepoint pillow.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, relax. We’re happy to have you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thank you, but how do I know you’re not saying that just to be nice?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Do you actually pay for that haircut?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’ll do it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, Raj, I owe you an apology. Look, could you please put your dog on a leash?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sheldon, she’s fine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, then at least hold her still so I can pretend she’s stuffed. Raj, I let my emotions get the best of me, and I unfairly took it out on you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thank you. I appreciate that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I can’t take all the credit. I spoke with Leonard’s mother, and she made me feel better.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know who you talked to, but that wasn’t my mother.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Beverly pointed out that I’m experiencing insecurities in my relationship with Amy, in the same way that Leonard and Penny are in their relationship.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What are you talking about? We’re fine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, you’re fine as long as you have a buffer living with you to distract from your marital problems. It used to be me. Now it’s Raj and his attack Tribble. Anyway, I’m sorry for everything. Oh, and FYI, if you cry while they’re fighting, they’ll take you to McDonald’s.

utterance.speaker: Beverley (on skype)
utterance.content: Hello, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why are you saying we have marital problems? We don’t have marital problems.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: I see. You must be yelling at me out of wedded bliss.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look, just because we took our friend in does not mean that Penny and I are afraid to be alone.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, this is a special circumstance.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Sheldon mentioned you tried to get your brother to live with you, as well.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, well, a circumstance can happen twice and still be special.

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Do you agree with that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, now that you point it out…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Are you kidding me?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We do seem to keep finding room mates.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Now you’re taking her side?

utterance.speaker: Beverley
utterance.content: Dear, I would never come between you and Leonard. That’s for your parade of room mates to do.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Howard? Howard? It’s me, it’s just me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I texted you, but you didn’t respond. Leonard and Penny were arguing.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Not on my watch.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s fine. It’s just Raj. You can hit him with the bat, but it’s fine.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: And if my heart stops, just let me go.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m sorry, guys. Sheldon was upset, Leonard and Penny were fighting, I just wanted to go some place where I wasn’t causing problems.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ll say it again. India.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Can I just stay in the garage?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Don’t do that. We’ll make up the couch for you and figure out something in the morning.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Come on, I’ll get you some sheets. Then I’ll see if I can beat my high score on the blood pressure machine.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Never should’ve had all these kids so close together.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t sleep.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Beverley believes I unconsciously consider my old room an escape hatch.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Is that bothering you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. I don’t care for unconscious thoughts. My brain and I are best friends. It should tell me everything.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I mean, how it relates to our relationship, not the bromance between you and your brain.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What if she’s correct? Doesn’t that say something troubling about us?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t know. I just think you’re the kind of person who likes a contingency plan.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That is true. Did you know I figured out in which order I would eat all my friends in the event of an apocalypse?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You need to stop hanging out with your brain so much. It’s not a good influence.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: If you’re looking for spare change, I already cleaned it out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, didn’t think this is where my life would be.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Me, either. I’m in a bedroom and you’re on a couch. I’m actually winning.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know, we’re both down on our luck. Maybe you and I should try to get a place together.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Okay, listen to me. There is no reason to leave here. This is great. Everyone’s nice. It’s comfortable. If all goes according to plan, this is my retirement home.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wouldn’t you feel better about yourself if you were more independent?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Better than I feel in their steam shower? I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny would be the entree. Then Leonard’s basically a cheese course. And because I love you, you’re dessert.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I want to say aw, but I’m gonna say ew.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, you see, I’m doing this so I can stop being spoiled and, you know, grow as a person.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Good for you. This sandwich has six dollars worth of ham in it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Don’t you even feel a little bad sponging off your friends?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hey, look, I went to art college, I tried to make it as a graphic artist, a comic book artist, and you know what I got for my efforts? A visible rib cage. I’m not kidding. You could see my heart beating.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, no offence, but I didn’t go to art school. I have a PhD in astrophysics.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, great, it’ll be easier for you to look up at the stars without a roof over your head.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Morning.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Did you know Raj moved out last night?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What? Why?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Leonard and Penny, I’m sorry for all the trouble I’ve caused. I went to stay at Howard’s. PS Cinnamon’s with me, but if you feel like messing with Sheldon, tell him she’s loose in the building.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I feel terrible.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Should we go bring him back?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, you’re the one worried having someone live with us is a sign of problems.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, that was just because my mother got in my head. It’s like being possessed, but instead of Satan it’s, actually, it’s the same thing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, so we’ll ask him to come back.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, great.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Don’t you want to get dressed first?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just one second. Help, Cinnamon’s loose in the building.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (off)
utterance.content: Amy, quick, lock the door.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We’re so sorry if we made you feel uncomfortable. We really weren’t fighting about you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I just never want to be a burden on my friends.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Me, either. Don’t want to be a burden. Hey, is that the baby? I’ll go check.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You are not a burden, and we want you to come back and stay with us.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But I also upset Sheldon, and he’s not gonna want to come over if I’m there.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: More reasons for you to stay.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Halley’s fine.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You know she’s at my parents’ house, right?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: And she’s having the time of her life.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: If you ever want to change things up, you’re always welcome here.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Just not in our bedroom, you dumbass.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I appreciate it, but I think staying with Leonard and Penny makes more sense for everyone.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Then it’s settled.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And just so you know, it’s only temporary. I’m not gonna get too comfortable.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Good. Nobody needs a mooch living in their house forever.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hey, that’s no way to talk about your baby.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know what? I’m proud of us. Yeah, with Penny and Leonard taking in Raj, and Stuart living with Howard and Bernadette, we’re the only couple of our social group who doesn’t need to fill the holes in their relationship with a third party.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yup, we’re killin’ it.
